data.title: The Return: Ja Morant is back for the Memphis Grizzlies
data.meta_description: December 19 has been a date that’s been on NBA fans’ calendars since the schedule was released this summer. Why is that? It was the return of Memphis Grizzlies’ point guard Ja Morant. After serving a…
data.text:
December 19 has been a date that’s been on NBA fans’ calendars since the schedule was released this summer. Why is that? It was the return of Memphis Grizzlies’ point guard Ja Morant. After serving a 25-game suspension, Morant was scheduled to make his debut in a road game against the New Orleans Pelicans.

NBA commissioner Adam Silver had to bring the hammer down on Ja Morant this off-season. After his second offense of flashing a gun on Instagram Live, the world expected a harsh punishment to take place. The questions that numerously surrounded Morant was how could a star be irresponsible by repeating the same behavior multiple times? The truth is, that many have made a mistake more than once. Sometimes it takes a harsh punishment like a 25-game suspension to finally realize what Morant was doing.

The Grizzlies had to begin the 2023–24 season without their franchise point guard. The question was who would step up in his absence? The Grizzlies featured other star talents like Jaren Jackson Jr and Desmond Bame. Despite their shining moments, the two showed that they can’t fill the…
